The sphere A is in equilibrium, so the net force on it is zero.
The gravitational force acting on the sphere A is mg, directed vertically downward.
The electrostatic force between the spheres A and B is given by \( F_{elec} = \frac{kq^2}{d^2} \).
Since the tension in the wire is zero, the component of the gravitational force along the inclined plane must be balanced by the electrostatic force.
The component of the gravitational force along the inclined plane is \( mg \sin \theta \).
Setting the electrostatic force equal to the component of the gravitational force, we get \( \frac{kq^2}{d^2} = mg \sin \theta \).
